title: IBM System/360 Mainframes
overview: IBM launches the System/360 mainframe family, driving the first wave of centralized computing facilities — precursors to modern data centers.

title: First Colocation Facilities
overview: The rise of colocation facilities allows multiple companies to host servers in shared spaces, lowering infrastructure costs.

title: Amazon Builds Large-Scale Data Centers
overview: Amazon begins building massive datacenters to support its growing e-commerce operations — later forming the foundation for AWS.

title: Equinix Founded
overview: Equinix launches to provide neutral colocation and interconnection services, becoming one of the largest global data center operators.

title: Google Hyperscale Data Centers
overview: Google pioneers hyperscale data centers with custom servers, efficient cooling, and global replication to power search and cloud services.

title: Facebook Prineville Data Center
overview: Facebook opens its Prineville, Oregon facility, showcasing advanced energy efficiency and launching the Open Compute Project.

title: Green Data Center Movement
overview: Companies begin investing in renewable-powered and energy-efficient data centers to reduce carbon footprints and costs.

title: Microsoft Underwater Data Center (Project Natick)
overview: Microsoft tests an underwater modular data center, exploring energy efficiency and proximity to coastal populations.

title: Edge Data Centers Rise
overview: The demand for ultra-low latency applications fuels the growth of small edge data centers closer to end users.

title: AI-Powered Data Centers
overview: Hyperscalers integrate AI for workload optimization, cooling efficiency, and predictive maintenance in large-scale facilities.
